location.Description: The location of the ACI and the storage account for the deployment script.

systemData.Description: Metadata pertaining to creation and last modification of the resource.

type.Description: Type of the managed identity. Possible values include: 'UserAssigned'

tenantId.Description: ID of the Azure Active Directory.

userAssignedIdentities.Description: The list of user-assigned managed identities associated with the resource. Key is the Azure resource Id of the managed identity.

principalId.Description: Azure Active Directory principal ID associated with this identity.

clientId.Description: Client App Id associated with this identity.

createdBy.Description: The identity that created the resource.

createdByType.Description: The type of identity that created the resource. Possible values include: 'User', 'Application', 'ManagedIdentity', 'Key'

lastModifiedBy.Description: The identity that last modified the resource.

lastModifiedByType.Description: The type of identity that last modified the resource. Possible values include: 'User', 'Application', 'ManagedIdentity', 'Key'

lastModifiedAt.Description: The timestamp of resource last modification (UTC)

properties.Description: Properties of the Azure PowerShell script object.

kind.Description: Object model for the Azure PowerShell script.

containerSettings.Description: Settings to customize ACI container instance.

storageAccountSettings.Description: Settings to use an existing storage account. Valid storage account kinds are: Storage, StorageV2 and FileStorage

cleanupPreference.Description: The clean up preference when the script execution gets in a terminal state. Default setting is 'Always'. Possible values include: 'Always', 'OnSuccess', 'OnExpiration'

provisioningState.Description: State of the script execution. This only appears in the response. Possible values include: 'Creating', 'ProvisioningResources', 'Running', 'Succeeded', 'Failed', 'Canceled'

status.Description: Generic object modeling results of script execution.

primaryScriptUri.Description: Uri for the script. This is the entry point for the external script.

supportingScriptUris.Description: Supporting files for the external script.

arguments.Description: Command line arguments to pass to the script. Arguments are separated by spaces. ex: -Name blue* -Location 'West US 2'

environmentVariables.Description: The environment variables to pass over to the script.

forceUpdateTag.Description: Gets or sets how the deployment script should be forced to execute even if the script resource has not changed. Can be current time stamp or a GUID.

retentionInterval.Description: Interval for which the service retains the script resource after it reaches a terminal state. Resource will be deleted when this duration expires. Duration is based on ISO 8601 pattern (for example P1D means one day).

timeout.Description: Maximum allowed script execution time specified in ISO 8601 format. Default value is P1D

azPowerShellVersion.Description: Azure PowerShell module version to be used.

containerGroupName.Description: Container group name, if not specified then the name will get auto-generated. Not specifying a 'containerGroupName' indicates the system to generate a unique name which might end up flagging an Azure Policy as non-compliant. Use 'containerGroupName' when you have an Azure Policy that expects a specific naming convention or when you want to fully control the name. 'containerGroupName' property must be between 1 and 63 characters long, must contain only lowercase letters, numbers, and dashes and it cannot start or end with a dash and consecutive dashes are not allowed. To specify a 'containerGroupName', add the following object to properties: { "containerSettings": { "containerGroupName": "contoso-container" } }. If you do not want to specify a 'containerGroupName' then do not add 'containerSettings' property.

startTime.Description: Start time of the script execution.

endTime.Description: End time of the script execution.

expirationTime.Description: Time the deployment script resource will expire.

error.Description: Common error response for all Azure Resource Manager APIs to return error details for failed operations. (This also follows the OData error response format.)

name.Description: The name of the environment variable.

value.Description: The value of the environment variable.

secureValue.Description: The value of the secure environment variable.

properties.Description: Properties of the Azure CLI script object.

kind.Description: Object model for the Azure CLI script.

containerSettings.Description: Settings to customize ACI container instance.

storageAccountSettings.Description: Settings to use an existing storage account. Valid storage account kinds are: Storage, StorageV2 and FileStorage

cleanupPreference.Description: The clean up preference when the script execution gets in a terminal state. Default setting is 'Always'. Possible values include: 'Always', 'OnSuccess', 'OnExpiration'

provisioningState.Description: State of the script execution. This only appears in the response. Possible values include: 'Creating', 'ProvisioningResources', 'Running', 'Succeeded', 'Failed', 'Canceled'

status.Description: Generic object modeling results of script execution.

primaryScriptUri.Description: Uri for the script. This is the entry point for the external script.

supportingScriptUris.Description: Supporting files for the external script.

arguments.Description: Command line arguments to pass to the script. Arguments are separated by spaces. ex: -Name blue* -Location 'West US 2'

environmentVariables.Description: The environment variables to pass over to the script.

forceUpdateTag.Description: Gets or sets how the deployment script should be forced to execute even if the script resource has not changed. Can be current time stamp or a GUID.

retentionInterval.Description: Interval for which the service retains the script resource after it reaches a terminal state. Resource will be deleted when this duration expires. Duration is based on ISO 8601 pattern (for example P1D means one day).

timeout.Description: Maximum allowed script execution time specified in ISO 8601 format. Default value is P1D

azCliVersion.Description: Azure CLI module version to be used.
